tool_description: 💣💣 Are you ready for the 2024 season? We definitely are!! 💣💣 Welcome to the Ultimate Tennis API!  It provides all the information you need about the tennis world, including all the details related to players and tournaments(live scores, matches, statistics), from both the ATP and tha WTA circuits, both singles and doubles . We also provide live bettings odds for every match in every tennis category. You can easily build your tennis related portal or enhance your Ml/AI projects.
name: Ultimate Tennis
title: Ultimate Tennis

api_list.name: Daily Schedule by Tournament ID
api_list.description: Retrieve the daily schedule for a specific tournament ID.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/atp/tournament_daily_schedule/580"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/atp/tournament_daily_schedule/{tournament_id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Global Players Statistics
api_list.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve global statistics about tennis players. You can customize the statistic (aces, breakpoints converted, 1st serve points won...), the season (all, 2022, 2021...), or the surface(clay, hard, grass).
You can find the list of available options under every parameter.

required_parameters.name: season
required_parameters.description:
Select season to select. Just pass the year:
all- all time rankings

The first year supported is 1991.

required_parameters.name: category
required_parameters.description: Available options are: **aces**, **1stserve**, **returngameswon**, **breakpointsconverted**, **returnpointswon2ndserve**, **returnpointswon2ndserve**, **returnpointswon1stserve**, **1stservepointswon**, **2ndservepointswon**, **servicegameswon**, **breakpointsaved**

required_parameters.name: surface
required_parameters.description: **clay**, **grass**or **hard**. Otherwise, just leave **all**to select all surfaces.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/global_players_stats/serve/career/all"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/global_players_stats/{category}/{season}/{surface}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Official ATP Players Rankings
api_list.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the rankings(**singles**+ **doubles**) of the current tennis season. You can arbitrarily decide the number of players displayed (nplayers) and the time window to refer to (timestamp).

For example, if nplayers = 10,  category= "singles" and timestamp = 2022-04-11 you will receive the top 10 singles standings at the corresponding timestamp (**IMPORTANT**: The timestamp must be in the following format **YYYY-MM-DD** and the date **must fall on Monday** since the rankings are updated at the start of every week)

required_parameters.name: timestamp
required_parameters.description:
Time window

**IMPORTANT**: The timestamp must be in the following format **YYYY-MM-DD** and the date **must fall on Monday** since the rankings are updated at the start of every week

required_parameters.name: category
required_parameters.description: singles or doubles

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/rankings/atp/singles/50/current"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/rankings/atp/{category}/{n_players}/{timestamp}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Live Players Rankings
api_list.description: With this endpoint, you can retrieve info about the live tennis rankings for a given number of players, with position/points/info about the last match played in the current active tournament. Please note that in the ATP circuit the official leaderboard is updated every Monday.

required_parameters.name: n_player
required_parameters.description: Max: 500.  Please provide just an Integer

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/live_leaderboard/50"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/live_leaderboard/{n_player}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: ATP Player Stats by ID
api_list.description: Via this endpoint you can retrieve official updated statistics for a given ATPplayer. Values are updated after every played match. ID can be retrieved from the Official ATP Players Rankings endpoint.

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: Specify a year

required_parameters.name: surface
required_parameters.description: Valid options are: clay, grass, hard, all.

required_parameters.name: player_id
required_parameters.description: ID can be retrieved from the Official ATP Players Rankings endpoint.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/player_stats/atp/su87/2023/all"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/player_stats/atp/{player_id}/{year}/{surface}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Player Info By ID
api_list.description: This endpoint provides YTD and Career details for a selected player. You can obtain the Player ID from the WTA Rankings endpoint.

required_parameters.name: player_id
required_parameters.description: Player ID

api_list.name: Player Stats by ID and Year

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: Just pass the year (e.g. 2022, 2021 ecc..)

For example, if nplayers = 10,  category= "singles" and timestamp = 2022-04-11 you will receive the top 10 singles standings at the corresponding timestamp (**IMPORTANT**: The timestamp must be in the following format **YYYY-MM-DD** )

required_parameters.name: timestamp

Time window

**IMPORTANT**: The timestamp must be in the following format **YYYY-MM-DD**

api_list.name: Tournament Results by ID and Year WTA
api_list.description: Via this endpoint, you can retrieve all the matches played in the selected tournament, in a given year. The results are added instantly for every match that ends. You can Retrieve the list of the IDs from the tournament list WTA endpoint.

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: Year to be selected. Please note that not all the tournaments have been played every year.

required_parameters.name: tournament_id
required_parameters.description: You can Retrieve the list of the IDs from the tournament list WTA endpoint.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/tournament_results/wta/709/2022"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/tournament_results/wta/{tournament_id}/{year}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Tournament List WTA
api_list.description: Via this endpoint, you can retrieve the list of all tournaments to be played in a selected year (from *1960* to *2022*).  We return some basic info about every row such as tournament venue, surface, prizemoney, etc. Results by Id and Year** endpoint

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: year must fall between 1960 and 2022

api_list.code:

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com/tournament_list/wta/{year}"

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "ultimate-tennis1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Tournament List
api_list.description: Via this endpoint, you can retrieve the list of all tournaments to be played in a selected year.  We return some basic info about every row such as tournament venue, surface, winners, etc. If you want to have all the details regarding the matches played in a single tournament you can use the **Tournament Results by Id and Year** endpoint

required_parameters.name: category
required_parameters.description:
Options:

- **atpgs**: Atp tournaments + grand Slams

- **atp**: Atp circuit

- **gs**: grand slams

- **1000**: Masters 1000

- **ch**: Challenger Circuit

api_list.code:

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Live Matches Stats
api_list.description: You can retrieve all te details related to a single match such as Aces, Break points, First Serve %, first serve returns, second serves, ecc..

required_parameters.name: match_id
required_parameters.description: Id identying the single match. It can be retrieved from the Live Scores with Live Betting Odds endpoint.

api_list.name: Live Scores with Live Betting Odds
api_list.description: This endpoint provides info about all the live matches from ATP + WTA. It includes live and prematch odds.

api_list.name: Player Ranking History by ID
api_list.description: You can access all the history of the rankings for a selected player. ID **must** be provided, you can retrieve a player ID from the Players Rankings endpoint.

required_parameters.name: player_id
required_parameters.description: Id of the player. A list of the IDs can be retrieved from the Players Rankings endpoint.

        }

api_list.name: Player Details by ID
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve specific details about a single player. ID **must** be provided, you can retrieve a player ID from the Players Rankings endpoint.

required_parameters.name: player_id
required_parameters.description: Id of the player. A list of the IDs can be retrieved from the Players Rankings endpoint.
